channel.title: theBalancedBriefNLtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from theBalancedBriefNLtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Browser Fingerprinting: What Your Browser Is Telling Everyone About You
item.description: Your browser sends a lot of information with each website you visit. That can be used to track you across the internet.

item.title: India’s Kuku snags $85M as mobile content wars intensify
item.description: Kuku plans to expand beyond India with a U.S. launch slated for next year.

item.title: Best Gifts for Babies and Toddlers, Tested and Approved by Our Own Kids
item.description: Shopping for tiny people is intimidating. Good news: We did it for you.

item.title: Zepto raises $450 million at $7 billion valuation as Indian quick commerce market heats up
item.description: Indian quick commerce startup Zepto said it has raised $400 million in a funding round led by a new investor, California Public Employees’ Retirement ...

item.title: Seoul weighs approval for Google, Apple high-resolution map requests
item.description: South Korea weighs granting Google and Apple access to high-resolution map data amid lingering security and regulatory concerns.

item.title: Co-founder of Indian social network Koo releases a new photo sharing app
item.description: PicSee is a new app that detects your friends' photos on device and allows you to send it to them.

item.title: Proton Mail Review (2025): The Email Service You Didn’t Know You Needed
item.description: Proton Mail gives you encrypted email, but more importantly, it puts you in the driver’s seat of your inbox.

item.title: Spit On, Sworn At, and Undeterred: What It’s Like to Own a Cybertruck
item.description: “We were the targets.” WIRED spoke to seven Tesla Cybertruck owners about their most controversial purchase and why they're proud to drive it.

item.title: How tiny Mubadala-backed AAF is winning VC deals in some of the hottest startups
item.description: In less than a decade AAF has backed startups with exits totaling $2 billion, it says and is doing so through an unusual VC model.

item.title: The AI Industry’s Scaling Obsession Is Headed for a Cliff
item.description: Huge AI infrastructure deals assume that algorithms will keep improving with scale. They may not.
